title: I have completed my 12 CBSE syllabus. Should I join a crash course from a different teacher (accelerated batch from physics wallah) or should I revise the syllabus by myself? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Hi! I would suggest you revise the syllabus on your own but you should start solving previous years’ question papers and sample papers of different competitive examinations. The more questions you'd solve, the more prepared you'd be for board examinations as well as for JEE Main or NEET.  You can get study materials for competitive examinations as well as sample papers for board examinations from different publications at MyPustak, free of cost. MyPustak ensures hassle-free delivery of your ordered books. Check out the website. Hope this was helpful. Thank you.

Thanks for A2A Look if you comoleted your 12th CBSE syllabus..then you should go for a crash course for jee….because…as you told that You already completed 12th syllabus…then if you go for crash course ,then they will teach you that point which will be the most important topic as per jee syllabus and your 12th syllabus also get revised…. Another option is That use DC pandey physics books because it makes your revision and also u will prepare for jee main easily…and if you stuck in doubt then go for youtube…. Thanks!!!
